articles.title: Farmers sound alarm as sheep industry collapses - is carbon farming to blame?
articles.author: Newstalk ZB
articles.summary: Farmers warn the sheep industry is collapsing. The sheep population has declined from 70 million just over 40 years ago to 25 million today. Farmers say carbon farming is the main factor. 260 thousand hectares of land was converted into forestry between 2017 and 2018.

articles.title: US faces another summer of extreme heat as fears rise over Trump cuts
articles.author: The Observer
articles.summary: This year's summer months are expected to be among the hottest on record across the United States. Alaska may escape the extreme heat. There is concern over the impacts of Trump administration cuts to key agencies on the environment and climate change.

articles.title: Florida bill would ban 'chemtrails' and 'geoengineering.' But what are they?
articles.author: Phys Dot Org
articles.summary: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis recently signed a law banning weather modification activities such as spreading tiny particles into the air from aircraft to control sunlight. There are long-standing controversies over "geoengineering" and "chemtrails" as well as "private businesses' view on global warming.

articles.title: Climate Change Committee alarms over waste crisis in Margalla Hills, demands urgent action
articles.author: Urdu Point
articles.summary: The National Assembly Standing Committee on Climate Change has raised serious concerns over unchecked waste dumping and sewage mismanagement in Margalla Hills National Park. It warns of severe environmental damage without immediate intervention in the park. The committee is concerned about the environmental damage in the MHNP.

articles.title: How to avoid the top 9 grilling mistakes \u2014 plus a few recipes to make ...
articles.author: Journal Gazette
articles.summary: I love to grill and barbecue. I have devoted my career to outdoor cooking for more than two decades. I put together a list of the biggest grilling don'ts and how to avoid them. Never oil the grill. Oil the food, not the grates.

articles.title: Permafrost thaw: Gradual change or climate tipping point?
articles.author: Phys Dot Org
articles.summary: The Arctic is warming almost four times faster than the rest of the planet. High temperatures are already happening in the Arctic.       in some places.  in others there are already high temperatures. in some areas the temperature has already reached dangerous levels.

articles.title: Study Warns Climate Change Threatens Middle East Wind Power
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: Climate change will drastically alter wind energy prospects across the Middle East, according to a joint Israeli-German study. There will be a decline in winds at turbine-operating heights, which will affect wind energy production in the region, it warns.

articles.title: Penguin poo plays a surprising role in Antarctic climate cooling: Study
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Penguin droppings or guano may be helping cool Antarctica by triggering cloud formation that reflects sunlight away from Earth. Ammonia released from penguin colonies significantly boosts the formation of cloud formation, according to the new study published in Communications Earth & Environment.

articles.title: Chinese ambassador questions ethics of Albanese's Darwin Port plan
articles.author: system
articles.summary: China's ambassador to Australia has fired a warning shot to the Commonwealth over its plans to take back the port of Darwin. He said the Commonwealth should be aware of China's plans to seize the port in the first place and not be surprised by them in the future.

articles.title: State stakes five per cent of its disaster budget on climate alerts
articles.author: Mactilda Mbenywe
articles.summary: Kenya will give 5% of Disaster Risk Management budget to early warning systems. Climate change is already costing Kenya 3-5% of its GDP annually. Kenya's average temperature has risen by 1°C since 1960. It could increase by another 2.5°C by 2050. The UN's Early Warnings for All initiative, launched globally in 2022, aims to change that.
